name: Brown TLV Urban Hotel

reviews.text: I really can't say anything negative about the Brown TLV! It is a great little boutique hotel on a residential street, not far from the beach promenade. Some wonderful restaurants and cafes are right around the corner, and Jaffa is about a 30 minute walk. The lobby is very welcoming, and I loved the contemporary '70s vibe they've created. The front desk staff were all very pleasant and helpful, and went out of their way to make sure I was comfortable and had anything and everything I could need. I was traveling solo and my room was a tight fit, but everything in the room (spotless black marble bathroom, clean linens, super comfortable bed, complimentary bottle of wine and chocolates, flat screen tv, air conditioning, huge windows) made my stay all the more enjoyable. If you want to get out of your room, the rooftop offered unbeatable views of the city, the Living Room was comfortable, and the terrace area off of the front desk are all good alternative options for spending your time. If you are going to breakfast at the Cafe Birenbaum, make sure to go early. I made the mistake of going around 11 and the place was jam-packed. I ended up at the Rothschild Cafe across the street (on the corner), and was able to get a great Israeli breakfast there. Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed my short visit at the Brown, and cannot wait to return on my next visit to Tel Aviv!
reviews.title: Great boutique hotel in Tel Aviv

reviews.text: enjoyed our 3 day trip back in israel tel a viv, this time in a beautifully located modern design hotel!!! loved the ambiance & it's compination of modern touch with vintage furnitures, giving a spectacular relaxation !!! service fantastic and amazing design in rooms with black touch and dark brown wood.... the top roof outdoor lounge bar as well as the exterior ground floor lounge are giving an american way of living and relaxation.... really fantastic hotel to stay in tel a viv and close to shabazi best shopping area as well as the best restaurants and cool places of nightlife in sleepless city of israel!!!!
reviews.title: Let's go modern & vintage !!! in heart of tel a viv!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chic hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. Complimentary services (such as free wifi, a bottle of cava on arrival, free coffee/ tea and biscuits in the lobby, bicycle rental, beach towels) are a plus. The lobby Breakfast is served in 3 cafés, in one café until 4 p.m. The room (Relax size) was clean and of sufficient size as the lobby (unlike other hotels) was welcoming and offering space to read, just relax or chat.
reviews.title: very pleasant stay at the Brown TLV

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is great (ten minute walk to the beaches, less than five minutes to Rothschild Blvd.). However the noise from two construction sites in proximity to the hotel was a bit annoying during the day. We also found room temperatures in the lobby pretty chilly due to air conditioning.
reviews.title: Dont stay more than 2 nights if you are solo traveller

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall we enjoyed our stay of four nights very much.
reviews.title: A great place.located just at the center.

reviews.text: Centrally situated in the hippest area of Tel Aviv this hidden gem of a hotel served as my home base for ten days. And I felt like a king in my home and not like a guest at a hotel. I cannot praise the hotel enough. Tens all around for design, atmosphere, amenities, spa, rooftop bar, and quality of room. What makes Brown TLV stand out are the little touches that leave a big impression. Outstanding staff that take an interest in their guests on a personal level. Breakfast included at nearby trendy cafes ( instead of the run of the mill hotel breakfast buffet). WIFI , 24 HrTea/coffee service in lobby, Cava flowing, The list goes on... I selflessly write this review as there are only 30 rooms at hand and I fear the next time I try and book (and there will definately be a next time) they will be completely sold out.
reviews.title: Best boutique hotel experience ever !! Bar none

reviews.text: I stayed for 3 nights in July for a beach holiday on a solo basis on my first time to Tel Aviv.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel and staff in an amazing city

reviews.text: Booked Brown TLV based on its location, boutique feel and value for money and from the moment I walked in the door it was the best hotel choice I have made in many years. Even though I arrived late at night the receptionist gave me a warm welcome including a glass of champagne, pointed out hot spots on a map, showed me to my room and the amazing roof terrace.
reviews.title: Great hotel, but most of all Excellent staff

reviews.text: Rooms are petite but are perfectly designed with amazing showers, great toiletries and an excellent selection of TV channels including english speaking. Welcome chocolates and bottle of wine are a nice touch.
reviews.title: Very cozy boutique hotel with really friendly staff

reviews.text: The roof terrace is fantastic to relax around and watch the sunshine with a glass of champagne. Reception is nice with all day coffee and chocolates
reviews.title: Great value at a great price

reviews.text: Hotel: stylish retro (modern) hotel. Amazing lobby. Lovely sunny garden. Coffee and biscuits on tap all day. REALLY great roof top bar.
reviews.title: Nearly perfect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room: I had a single at first which is very small. However its very very comfortable with a great walk in shower. Excellent bottle of wine and gorgeous chocolates on arrival. I was moved to a double which was a decent size.
reviews.title: Tel Aviv Oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast: you choose one of three local cafes, which I loved. Full breakfast including multiple coffees, juice etc.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Tel Aviv for Hip Travelers

reviews.text: Staff: could not be better. Friendly, welcoming and professional. I had a few things go wrong, which were just bad luck and not the hotel's fault, but its not what goes wrong, its the way its handled, and it could not have been handled better.
reviews.title: Stylish hotel with great service

reviews.text: Location: great location. Walking distance to everything and 5 minutes cycle (bike provided by hotel for free) / 20 minutes walk to the beach.
reviews.title: Amazing Stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: what a perfect place - first time a year ago, second time for the weekend after our wedding - perfect location-close to everything - great breakfast in coffee-house near by, beautiful room and great coffee cookies and fruit in the lobby... coming back for sure!!!!
reviews.title: we are in lLOVE with this hotel!

reviews.text: My colleague and I stayed at Brown Hotel for one week. I've returned to Brown since my last visit to Tel-Aviv this spring. All my expectations were fully justified. Above the all "excellent marks" I could add only the special atmosphere that exist in Brown, it is a unique feeling of personal touch from hotel personal and home-like attitude to the guests. Next time in Tel-Aviv - no doubts I will stay at Brown.
reviews.title: Returning customers enjoys the best service they may expect.

reviews.text: This hotel is located at the heart of Tel Aviv, yet in a tranquil street. When you arrive, you're greeted with a glass of Cava and a smile. The staff is really friendly and willing to help, but it doesn't feel mechanical, they are truly nice people (they're also on a trendy side, which matches the spirit of the hotel - whoever is hiring these people is doing a really good job).
reviews.title: Stylish, yet feels like home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the lobby, you'll find a nice library with some really classic books. Also a fully automated espresso and chocolate machine, a great selection of teas and fresh, variate cookies.
reviews.title: Brown is my home in Israel

reviews.text: I arrived really early, so my room wasn't ready. Having some coffee and a table to work while I wait was just fine. I could also get breakfast nearby - they don't have catering, but they let you choose from 3 places that serve breakfast up to 4pm, which was just fine to me (actually, it was great, since I'm no morning person). Since I had to wait for my room, I freshened up a little in their clean, comfortable restroom and went out for a business lunch. When I got back, my bags were already in my room and I was already checked in. Really nice not having to go through check-in and carry my bags, being really tired at this point.
reviews.title: Great Staff! Good central location. Not a lot of unnessesary perks. Free wifi.

description: There's a new color in town. In the heart of Tel Aviv's urban scene, at the crossroads of the charming Neve Tzedek quarter and trendy Rothschild Boulevard and a ten minute walk from the beach, the Brown TLV Hotel is an ideal choice for the seasoned business traveler as well as the lifestyle-driven individual eager to access the vibrant city. Arts and culture, dining and nightlife are all outside our door. The Brown boutique hotel caters to the value-minded, yet stylishly discerning guest. Combining unique retro design, stylish ambiance and personalized service, Brown TLV is an award winning hotel recommended by international magazines such as NY Times, Wallpaper, Conde Nast Traveller, Vogue and Time Magazine.
